location.merchant_description_html: Prepare yourselves, plebeians! The kings of India Castle bring forth Cambridge’s supreme Indian cuisine. Salute seven days of fiery flavors for lunch and dinner from the regal jewel. Forget Naan and water. This generous Castle doesn’t let anyone go hungry. Buffet for all commoners at lunch. See the longest menu scroll in the kingdom for specialties, sauces, princely Chicken Tikka Masala, Samosas, Lamb Saag, and more. India Castle bestows a lavish feast at every visit. Royalty never tasted so good.

My neighbors are crazy. They painted their van a rich mocha color then drizzled it in pink. Suspicious....yet sweet. Must investigate. I stealthily pressed my noggin to the glass and couldn't believe what I saw: candy-coated cargo. The loaded inventory of cupcakes included a row of Red Velvets, a cluster of Chocolate Ganaches, even a cart of Cookies and Creams! But they are clearly taking these sweets to the streets, 1600 JFK Boulevard says the window. Wait. a. minute. My neighbors run Sweet Box, award-winning mobile cupcakery?!

Listen up! Lunchtime powerhouse, Bailey & Sage is making some noise in the Financial District! *Sizzle* Pieces of chicken receive their charred stripes of honor from the grill. *Whoosh* Air escapes as bubbly loaves of bread emerge from the hot oven. *Chop* Salad architects aggressively spin overflowing bowls as they dice up crisp veggies and tasty toppings. *Gasp* Diners are in awe of the enormous sandwiches, stacked high with more than 10 layers of top-notch meats! In their book, a noisy kitchen equals a delicious lunch!

Let’s get one thing straight. I’m kind of a big deal. Pat’s Cafe knows that. I get the VIP treatment the minute I step in the door. Smiling staff rush to seat me and take my coffee order. My Banana Granola Pancakes are served until 2:30PM because I don’t wake up before noon for less than $10,000 a day. When I lunch, the GLC (Garlic. Lime. Cilantro) Fries are always piping hot. After 5:30PM I devour Pat’s Beef Bourguigon. Slow cooked for 5 hours, it spends more time in a sauna than I do.

Hey, you at NYU! We’ve seen you dominate late-night pizza and crush beers like it’s 1925 (look it up, college kid.) Today calls for a heaping of health at KuKu Cateen. The menu consists of  traditional Asian dishes that have been given a lean makeover. Hot Ramen soup, Bibimbop bowls and Kimchi Pajun pancakes are remixed with surprising veggies, paired with savory steamed sides. But, just because you’re fulfilling your health quota doesn’t mean beer is out of the question. KuKu Canteen has Happy Hour from 5:30-7pm on weekdays. Beer is $4, and a Beer + Dumpling combo is $6. Consider it a boozy health kick.

Do you know the Dumpling Man who lives on St. Marks Place? No? Well pop in, take a barstool, and watch nimble fingered dumpling makers prepare their northern Asian renditions just for you! Get pork, chicken, veggie, shrimp, or surprise! Steam or sear 6-10 pieces, or buy a la carte! Soup, salad, sweets, special sauces—he’s got those too! Steamed shrimp dumplings stuffed with fish, ginger, corn and black beans? Dessert? Almond flan? Yes please! And now you know the Dumpling Man, the Dumpling Man, the…

Never fear, Kabobs are here! Saving the Liberty Place food court from the chains that bind them, Zaffron delivers Mediterranean grilled kabobs on the fly. Locally grown, fresh, and flavorful: pick chicken, steak, shawarma, falafel or veggies. Choose to wrap it in pita, toss it with salad or plate it with saffron rice. Grab hummus on the side and top it with feta, jalapeno, or whatever suits your tastes. Zaffron is changing the fast-food world one Kabob at a time and delighting taste buds Philly-wide!

Pancho Villa is starting a Mexican Revolution in your mouth. The Mission taqueria is banishing bland burrito blues with authentic Mexican fare and fresh fixins. Mojado Burritos are smothered in red chili sauce. Lengua Tacos tango with your tongue. Carnita Dinners pack a huge punch with rice, beans and tortillas on the side. Conquer new flavor frontiers by piling on 9 salsas at the epic salsa bar. Sips of fruity Agua Fresca or creamy Horchata are the perfect finish to a revolutionary meal. Viva Mexico!

Ahh Philly, the city of brotherly love. Here Old America meets modern chic at Cafe Twelve, appropriately nestled into South 12th Street. Abuzz with locals, Twelve offers cafe fare and fraternal harmony. Sip a Cubano sweetened with a perfect sugar dose while you sit outside and people-watch. Or, absorb the artsy, casual vibe inside as you enjoy a celebrated Turkey, Brie, and Apple sandwich, smothered in to-die-for fig spread. The Liberty Bell itself would ring its praises, if it could move.

Before the invention of scissors, hair could only be shortened naturally through inevitable bonfire curiosity. But with modern times, emerged a tribe of skilled shearsmen from Quincy. These artisans, schooled in hairstyles tame and wild are hailed for their clipping, textures and shaping. For about $20 you can get a haircut or a hot shave while enjoying their signature 21st century barbershop luxuries! You can surf the web on a Crew Cutz laptop, catch some news on the flattie or request a song on to play throughout the shop! Smooth moves!

What happens when you ASSUME? Tragedy. I assumed bubbles were for kids, so I kicked the habit when I was 12. Turns out, Just Sweet doles out the adult version in the form of Bubble Tea. I also thought that Just Sweet only had…well…sweets. Imagine my shock when I saw Fish Ball Ramen Noodles on the same menu as Ice Cream Mochi. My last tip: never assume there’s only one way to do things. If I want to eat my banana-chocolate-drizzled Dark Forest Crepe before my Pork Dumplings, that’s just how it’s gonna be.

Emerging from Reading forest, you see flowers everywhere! They smell so sweet; you start to lie down. But you’re not in Oz anymore. This isn’t the poppy field! It’s Market Blooms, a full service cut flower market bringing shiny sunflowers, zinnias, marigolds, amaryllis and more! The plants come organically grown from Market Blooms’ farm and specially picked from other farms to provide the best selection. So wake up, smell the roses, and buy a bouquet before following the yellow brick road away!

You love your BFF and you’re glad she’s back in sunny San Fran after spending 3 months touring Europe. After a night of welcome home drinks, you cannot hear another story about how Europe is soooo much better than America, so you dash to Le Petit Marchet. Between bites of Shawerma, Paninis and Pizza she mentions missing candy bars. Casually nod to the Euro candy spread: A full line-up of German Kinder Bars. Cadbury’s greatest chocolate creations. Aero Mint Bars. No passport required.

By day, Mission Bar and Grill’s a lovely hostess beckoning Bostonians into her classy abode. She happily serves lunch (and brunch on Sat & Sun!) Piling a beloved Mission Burger on your plate, she wins you over with hand-packed ground chuck heaven, topped with lettuce, tomato and red onion. By night, she’s a sultry fox luring you with Barbecued Cola Marinated Steak Tips. She’ll convince you to stay late for a drink and Skillet Roasted Mussels. Her duel personalities make everyone go weak in the stomach.

Two questions. Do you crave a tasty explosion in your mouth? Do you like it raw? Makiman Sushi knew it. The spicy sushi sultan of Washington Square offers the most alluring sushi you’ll ever consume, and entrees intent on seduction. Taste the Stone Pot Bi Bim Bop and the pleasure won’t stop. Try a Sixers Roll for double-sided shrimp tempura/spicy tuna divinity. Ride the Yellow Stallion for a bucking bite. Makiman ensnares even the most moral souls into its tantalizing web of sushi sensuality. You’re next.

It was a dark and stormy night when I opened the door into the warm glow of Piatto Grille. Greeted by the scent of simmering Italian, I sat down to a comforting meal. It started with Roasted Sweet Potato Gnocchi, luscious pillows gently tossed with a sage buerre blanc and prosciutto. Each bite of the old world Meatball Marinara cheered me. Homemade Caramel Chocolate Tort only sweetened my visit more. I left Piatto and headed into the night with a smile, my leftovers and a promise to return!

My relationship with Buffalo Wings is always testy, and Atomic Wings amplifies the tension. First, I choose a style (Buffalo, Boneless or ½ and ½.) Determining flavor is where legends are born. I can go with sweet sauces like BBQ, a “Sane” sauce (you know, where the Mild things are), or I can go big. The “Insane” sauces: Abusive, Nuclear, or Suicidal. I opt for a crispy, battered Suicide mission with a side of the Famous Waffle Fries and a Chicken Wrap. Today, Wings, you will bow to my digestive power.

Oh Conshohocken Cafe, you tug my heartstrings! Whether I’m alone, with family or my faithful Fido, you invite me for breakfast, lunch and weekend brunch. The Sunrise Surf & Turf starts my morning right with bacon, egg, crab cake and cheese jazzed with Old Bay and Sriracha on a Kaiser Roll. For lunch, the Three Piggies sammy please! Brunch brings treats like apple, cherry and walnut stuffed Challah Bread French Toast, topped with whipped cream and caramel. Keep my heart safe, sweet cafe. You’ve stolen it!

The Dining Car, one of Boston's premier food trucks, brings you an eclectic menu of hearty and healthy fare inspired by cuisines from around the world.

SCHEDULE - subject to change, check twitter @thediningcar

Monday - Greenway - Dewey Square - 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM

Wed and Fri - BU East - 11:00 AM - 2:45 PM

Tue and Thu - Greenway - Dewey Square at Congress Street 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM

Saturday - Boston Public Library - 11:00 AM - 2:00 PM

Contact us through diningcar.net
location.name: Rose Kennedy Greenway - Mon, Tue, Thu

location.merchant_description_html:
Sebastians is a local, family-owned business that serves the freshest, finest American and International fare to the Boston and Cambridge, Massachusetts communities.  Our cafés in Boston and Cambridge serve health conscience menus for breakfast, coffee, and lunch, while providing drop-off corporate catering to businesses, and special event catering to the Commonwealth.

I guess you could say we are Wicked Fresh! ;)
location.name: Seaport

location.merchant_description_html: Long menus typically mean something. All the food can’t be THAT good, right? Surprise! At the Upper West Side’s Famous Amadeus Pizza, they deliver consistently fine food menu-wide! Craving a combo with a side of fries and soda? Pick Chicken, Gyro or more! Take on jalapeno, onions, tomatoes, peppers and beef on the Tex Mex Pizza. Garlic Knots will put your stomach in joyous knots. Salivate over a healthy salad or comfort yourself with Baked Ziti. Amadeus is Famous for many delicious reasons.

Sebastians is a local, family-owned business that serves the freshest, finest American and International fare to the Boston and Cambridge, Massachusetts communities.  Our cafés in Boston and Cambridge serve health conscience menus for breakfast, coffee, and lunch, while providing drop-off corporate catering to businesses, and special event catering to the Commonwealth.

I guess you could say we are Wicked Fresh! ;)

location.name: Devonshire

location.merchant_description_html: Freshii is kicking fast, fresh food up a notch with their mantra to 'Eat. Energize.' If you've visited Freshii lately you may have noticed some changes. The new bold décor, digital menu boards and a new menu to boot. Freshii is providing guests more of the things they want. Like? More flavorful meal options, new ingredients and dressings, less filler, packaging that's easier to enjoy and a menu of 20 new chef-designed creations that are simply delicious! One thing that hasn't changed? Their commitment to your health. Freshii is focused on nutritious meals that energize and help you live the lifestyle you want. Stop by 100 High St. M-F from 7am-4pm for Breakfast, Lunch and all your snack needs.

Though some places claim they’ll do it my way, when I need to turn my serious salad swag on, I don’t mess around. I hit up Tootsie’s Salad Express where I mix fresh hot and cold offerings better than Tiesto. Check out my signature sweet potato spinach-spring mix with sunflower seeds. And for a fly $5.99/lb, you bet I’ll upgrade to a fried whiting fish Caesar Salad. If it’s comfort foods I crave, Tootsie’s has my staples: Mac & Cheese, BBQ Ribs and Collard Greens. This is what it’s like to be salad VIP.

When you’re in The Gallery, sometimes you just want to get in and get out. Don’t be intimidated by the crowds at Tiffany’s Bakery. People aren’t waiting in line, they’re just lusting over beautifully iced Cupcakes and 24 karat Carrot Cake. People come from all over to fawn over the flaky Danish. Remember this edible art is not just for admiring. The only thing better than swooning for Sweet Potato Pie is spooning tasty bites into your belly!

In Reading Terminal, I spy with my eye, a tasty, delicious Homemade Spinach Pie. Falafel is fine and so is Shawerma, but Kamal’s Middle Eastern has sides that’ll warm ya. Where else can I find Fresh Juices and treats to wash down Greek Salads and Kebabs full of meat? And in a glass case, like fine, royal jewels, are delicious desserts. Who would pass them? A fool! I savor the Baklava, each sweet, sticky bite. Order another? Well, Sir, I just might! I’ll eat til my pants start to feel tight!

The Flying Monkey is not simply a cakery or a cookie shop. It’s a full-service custom bakery in Reading Terminal Market that recently flipped the dessert world upside down with the debut of their Pumpple Cake. This double decker cake is a must-have for the upcoming holiday season. The top layer consists of a apple pie baked INTO a vanilla cake while the bottom layer mashes a pumpkin pie with chocolate cake. The whole thing is carefully dressed in buttercream frosting. Brave bakers, continue to monkey around with your recipes...the results are delicious!

At Lancaster County, “fresh” isn’t a word that is used loosely. It’s a promise! Located in the heart of Reading Terminal Market, this stand sells only the best homemade jams and preserves with homemade flavor. Pick out seasonal produce to feature in your favorite recipes, or bring home fun crafts for your kids. Savor the taste of their natural, fresh-ground Peanut Butter with Butterscotch, and you might be hooked. Don’t blame them… it’s a gift from Mother Nature herself. Lancaster County Farm Fresh is open from Wed-Sat, from 8AM-5PM.

It’s a little known fact, but the 5 Olympic Rings symbolize the tenets of an outstanding pizza and sub shop. As a gold medalist, Olympic Pizza blazes the way to pizza perfection. The Blue ring is for A+ toppings. Olympic Pizza uses full strips of bacon, not tiny crumbles. Black is for always serving pies like the Greek Special, piping hot. Red’s for solid Meatball Grinders and Yellow is for rockin’ sides like crisp, golden homemade Onion Rings. And Green? Smiles for miles, after every bite of tasty pie!
